title: Moment In Time: February 1994, Surya Bonaly's illegal figure-skating backflip
text:
Surya Bonaly does not like to be called a rebel - yet her reputation as the one to upset the status quo is iconic in the history of figure skating.

The moment the French skater used her toe pick to propel herself through the air in a backflip, landing on one foot before raising her head to the crowd, her fate was sealed.

Bonaly knew she would never win an Olympic medal. In Nagano 1998 - her third and final Games - she trailed in sixth place after her short program. Gold was completely out of her reach and, due to an Achilles injury, she couldn’t possibly land the jumps to earn silver or bronze.

In her free skate she made a split decision between throwing her triple lutz or doing something more spectacular. “That was my last Olympics, and pretty much my last competition ever,” she told The Root in 2014.

“I wanted to leave a trademark.” Bonaly knew she would be penalised for the move. The backflip was banned in 1976 - three years before she was born - after American Terry Kubicka landed a two-footed version at the Innsbruck Olympics.
description: Surya Bonaly does not like to be called a rebel - yet her reputation as the one to upset the status quo is iconic in the history of figure skating.
